com.pilot.jword
Class JWordDocument

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.text.AbstractDocument
      javax.swing.text.DefaultStyledDocument
          com.pilot.jword.JWordDocument
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.text.Document, javax.swing.text.StyledDocument
public class JWordDocument
extends javax.swing.text.DefaultStyledDocument

The document implementation used by the JWordTextPane class. This class has extra features like table implementation, header-footer,multi section documents. The branch structure is as follows: Document
-BodyElement
--DocumentSectionElement
---TableElement
----RowElement
-----CellElement
------ParagraphElement
--------LeafElement
---ParagraphElement
----LeafElement
-FooterElement
---TableElement
----RowElement
-----CellElement
------ParagraphElement
--------LeafElement
---ParagraphElement
----LeafElement
-HeaderElement
---TableElement
----RowElement
-----CellElement
------ParagraphElement
--------LeafElement
---ParagraphElement
----LeafElement

See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
 class JWordDocument.BodyElement
          Container for the section data (except header/footers) Childs must be DocumentSectionElement type
 class JWordDocument.CellElement
          Represents table's cell element.
 class JWordDocument.DocumentRootElement
          The root element of a document This will hold the BodyElement, and the Header/Footer elements.
 class JWordDocument.DocumentSectionElement
          Data part of a document section.
 class JWordDocument.EquationElement
          Represents dynamically changing text objects (fields) in the document:page number,page count,document info,symbol etc.
 class JWordDocument.FieldElement
          Represents dynamically changing text objects (fields) in the document:page number,page count,document info,symbol etc.
 class JWordDocument.FooterElement
          footer part of a document section
 class JWordDocument.HeaderElement
          Header part of a document section
 class JWordDocument.ListLevelChangeUndoableEdit
          An edit which changes a list level format within the document
 class JWordDocument.ParagraphElement
          Represents a single paragraph
 class JWordDocument.RowElement
          Represents table's row.
 class JWordDocument.TableElement
          Represents a table and is composed of RowElements

getListLevelAt

public ListLevel getListLevelAt(int position,
                                boolean stopAtNonEmptyLines)
returns the latest level of the list occupying the given offset. The paragraph at the offset might not actually be numbered, any list continuing from previous paragraphs will be returned. Returns null if no lists at all

deleteTable

public void deleteTable(int offset)
                 throws javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
Deletes table from the document. Method tries to find a deepest table for given offset and deletes it. If no table found method does nothing (throws exception).

Parameters:
offset - offset in the document.
Throws:
javax.swing.text.BadLocationException

deleteRow

public void deleteRow(int offset)
               throws javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
Deletes row from table. Method tries to find a deepest table for given offset and deletes row which contains given offset. If no table found method throws exception.

Parameters:
offset - offset in the document.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
javax.swing.text.BadLocationException

deleteRows

public void deleteRows(JWordDocument.TableElement table,
                       int startRow,
                       int endRow)
                throws javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
Deletes multiple rows from table. Method tries to find a deepest table for given offset and deletes rows which contains given offset range. If no table found method throws exception.

Parameters:
table - table
startRow - starting row >=0
endRow - ending row >=0
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
javax.swing.text.BadLocationException

deleteColumn

public void deleteColumn(int offset)
                  throws javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
Deletes column from table. Method tries to find a deepest table for given offset and deletes column which contains given offset. It means that we get index of cell which contains given offset and for each table's row delete cell with this index. If no table found method throws exception.

Parameters:
offset - offset in the document.
Throws:
javax.swing.text.BadLocationException

insertRow

public void insertRow(int offset,
                      boolean insertAbove)
               throws javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
Inserts new row into deepest table for specified offset. Method tries to find a deepest table for given offset than defines row which contains given offset and inserts new row above or below (depends on flag) current. If no table found throws exception

Parameters:
offset - offset in the document.
insertAbove - if true inserts row above current row
Throws:
javax.swing.text.BadLocationException

                                   javax.swing.text.AttributeSet attrs,
                                   boolean replace)
Sets attributes for paragraphs. This method is thread safe, although most Swing methods are not.

Parameters:
offsets - the offset into the paragraph >= 0
lengths - the number of characters affected >= 0
attrs - the attributes
replace - whether to replace existing attributes, or merge them

insert

public void insert(int offset,
                   ContentTree content,
                   boolean removeLastLine,
                   int section,
                   int dest)
            throws javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
insert the content described in the content tree into the given offset

Parameters:
offset - offset to insert into (can be set to -1 to use the start offset of the specified destination)
content - the content tree
removeLastLine - should remove the last line after insertion?
section - the section to insert into
dest - destination (header,footer,body) in the section to insert into
Throws:
javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
